Reviews.Title: “Couldn't sleep because of the noise.”
Reviews.Author: IvanCDG
Reviews.Content: Although the location is excellent, the noise factor is a HUGE problem. The flip-side of the location is that it is by a street with LOTS of noise. My sleep was completely ruined. The staff were not particularly pleasant, either. Frankly, I would avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to sleep at night this is not for you”
Reviews.Author: Karen G
Reviews.Content: We chose the mermaid because it's location and so much regretted that. Next time I choose a hotel I will take notice of the reviews! I couldn't believe how noisy it was, It was like party time on new years eve (except it was February) in the street was screaming , shouting, singing and arguing until 5.00am We had a family room but it was very small and only had wall lights so it was quiet dark. The stairways were narrow and staying on the second floor without any lift it was not nice. In the hotels defence the rooms was extremely clean. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone

Reviews.Title: “ALL ABOUT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: PETERANDWENDY_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mermaid for 2 nights. It was very clean and well maintained. There are quite alot of stairs if you have heavy luggage (No lift). A basic continental style breakfast is served in the restaurant below the main reception to hotel guests only. Although a little pricey for its standard, you cannot beat the hotels location, which is almost on Oxford Street, with Bond Street Tube station around the corner. Yet the Hotel is in a quiet side street. I shall use this Hotel/location again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bravo2012
Reviews.Content: Well it is called as a hotel but it is not. It is a four separate building opposite to each other & to get to the other one you have to cross the street. I went with my wife & my 3yr old son & were given a 4th floor room insipte of other rooms avialable in th ebelow floors. They provide breakfast which includes bread butter & cereals. At night the street is very noisy & we could not sleep. It is at a very good location for shopping which was the reason we choose it but woould not advise it to anyone. The heating was not appropriate & when called the reception were told that's the max it is & we shivered the whole night. There's no lift in the so called hotel. If you need something you would have to come down from your building cross the road & go to the reception on the first floor. It is just next to the bond street station & their are some eat outs near by.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: Franz_Zena
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel for just a single night. I've to say that the room was nice and clean, even if a bit too small. The best was the bathroom that was very big with a nice shower. For the breakfast they gave me a voucher to be used in the restaurant just below the hotel. I arrived too early and I had to wait a bit, but the breakfast was very good! I liked the hotel and it was in a wonderful spot in centre.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only good thing about this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: geminilady28
Reviews.Content: Room very very basic,lots and lots of stairs no lift,do not take heavy cases,unfriendly staff,breakfast discusting I wonder from which continental menu this was devised? no breakfast selection, just lobbed in front of you on a plate with no conversation, we had a long black hair in the coffee cup yak,I would NOT recommend this Hotel to others

Reviews.Title: “Put it down to experience”
Reviews.Author: crolls
Reviews.Content: We wanted to arrive a day early to the hotel we were booked into but they were full. We went online to find a hotel nearby, We came up with the Mermaid but sorry to say we did not read any reviews. The taxi driver went past it twice because it is just a doorway between two businesses. We carried our heavy bags up a long narrow staircase and found a very unfriendly woman in a small room that was the reception, We were told we had to pay in advance and we should pay cash or there would be a 4% surcharge. We were then told our room was across the street so we had to carry the bags down the stairs and up another set of stairs in the building opposite. The room was small but clean but the night noise was terrible. The windows are very poor and you could here people outside like they were in the room and seemed to go on all night. Trash trucks were busy nearly all night also. The bathroom though very clean was only about 6" X 6" and that is generous. You had to sit on the toilet sideways because the shower was so close and the shower was not big enough to bend over to wash your feet. Paid about $180 for the night which I know is cheap for London but we expected a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl131313
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good located. It has easy access to the oxford and Bond street. It is close to the Bond Street Tube Station. The rooms are in 3 differend houses. We were at an other house than the Lobby was, so you had to exit the hotel to go to the Lobby or for breakfast. You have to use your roomkey to enter the house, only one roomkey was provided, so that was very unpractical for 2 people staying in a double room and coming home for different times. You could hear the door everytime someone entered or exited the building. Breakfast was ok, it wasn't plenty or much choise but ok. It was only served for 1 and a half hours, so we missed it most of the time. If you want to check out before 7 am you have to inform the Lobby one day in advance. Staff was not friendly and not very helpfull. We wanted to check in early at about noon, but that was not possible. So we stored our luggage at the lobby ( avery small lobby) that was o the fisrt floor with no elevator. Later when we could check in, we had a room in an other house at the fisrt first floor, so wee had to carry our luggage again up the stairs on the other side of the street. The staircase was very steep and narrow, so it was complicated to get it up or down with the suitcase. The room and bathroom was clean and nice. The TV was very small, and only had 4 different channels. The shower was very small and water did run very slow, but still it would not go down the drain very well. So the person showering after you, was still standing with his feet in your showerwater. The windows in the room didn't close properly. That didn't help with the soundproofness.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous little hotel and restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Julieanne61
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a lovely stay at this hotel, fabulous room, plenty of towels and toiletries available. Very clean, staff was very polite and very helpful. Plenty of literature available at reception for tourists. The restaurant downstairs served fabulous food and again the staff here were fantastic. The location is brilliant, everything we could have asked for. Only negative thing is the lack of a lift, so you do have to be physically able to climb stairs, apart from this I would certainly recommend this Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location... nothing more”
Reviews.Author: AuMi007
Reviews.Content: If you choose this hotel, do it only for the location (in the center, 3 minutes walk from Bond Station and next to oxford street). The receptionist was unpleasant, our room on the 3rd floor was badly soundproofed (we could ear every step from the room above). When arriving I had to ask for towels which were missing. But the worse was the breakfast: it was served in the pizzeria (groundfloor of the main building) only for 1h30 and consisted in 4 half toasts with 2 small pots of jam and a a bit of cheese (babybel) and a cup of tea or coffee. On a table you could have a glass of poor orange juice and a bowl of cereals or yoghurt. very desappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Frizzy304
Reviews.Content: It was with trepidation after reading the previous reviews that I stayed at this hotel. I needn't have worried, for the price it was perfectly situated and adequate for our needs. If you want a fair priced hotel in the centre of London then stay here. Yes, there are a lot of steps and the breakfast is a little basic and some of the showers have discoloured sealant, (that happens to your own stuff in time) - it is clean!! If you want top of the range then go around the corner and stay in the Langham - and pay their ridiculous prices!! If you want affordable and clean accommodation, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the city center”
Reviews.Author: pacina
Reviews.Content: 1) the position is super! it's very centrally located (10 minutes walk from Oxford Circus tube station) and therefore very convenient for sightseeing and shopping in particular because it is located practically on the main shopping street in London 2) the width of the room (very big!!), we had a triple that was pratically a small apartment including a kitchen, washing machine, cooker, water boiler to make tea/coffee 3) the excellent cleaning of the room and the bathroom. Breakfast is continental, but it is not serf-service (2 slices of bread are served with butter and jam, a small cheese, honey, cereals) and then, not very abundant, but overall good and sufficient. There is no lift, and we found the room warm when we arrived, but the following day the heaters were not turned on. No wireless

Reviews.Title: “Great location but very poor standard!”
Reviews.Author: MrsPerfectBerlin
Reviews.Content: My priority was to be in town and have a safe, clean place to go back to for the night since I was on my own. The location is indeed perfect, just round the corner from Oxford Street. But the standard of the my room was very very poor. I am usually not so picky - it's fine if there's no shower mat or no shampoo, it was just one night I was going to spend there anyway. However, the furniture was incredibly old and dusty, the feeling was of a place which is hardly ever cleaned. It felt like the whole room had gone stale, it just did not smell fresh. More than a hotel it reminds me of those cheap bed&breakfast for young students. Unfortunately I am past that stage and if I spend Â£ 98 per night I do not expect luxury but at least hygene. This place should have one, maximum two stars, certainly not three! Needless to say: no internet connection, no room service, nothing you would expect for that price in a modern hotel. Again, fine with me for one night, but if you are on a business trip and need these facilities just stay clear. If you pay with card 5% will be charged. Also quite infrquent in modern world. You may end up in a different building than the reception, you may want to know if you are pregnant/elderly/frail as you will have a flight of stairs in front of you any time you need the reception, and another one if you are staying in a room opposite to reception. I was on top floor, that is three flights of stair every time. I did not try the breakfast, but the restaurant looked fine from the outside. One last thing: if you are travelling on your own, you may not like that you cannot lock the door but just use a metal chain which even a child could break.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: MRjACKNorthWales
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 2 friends in a quad room for one night, the room was very spacious and nice and light, very comfortable, hotel wasextreamley good value a simple but adequet breakfast was included in the price.The only negative was the hotel staff that we encountered was the receptionist when we checked in and out, she wasn't the friendliest of staff I have ever met and the towels smelt a bit musty but were not unclean overall the generally cleanliness was very good and the location is brilliant very easy to get to,and is within 5 mins walk of the nearest tube station and the hotel was on a quite road right of bond street. Overall I would definatley visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Within easy reach of London attractions”
Reviews.Author: MissFairway
Reviews.Content: We arrived early Saturday morning and once you get used to the inner city one way system, the hotel is easily located off New Bond Street. Multistorey car park only a 10 min walk away. Very friendly service when checking in, Ã¤nd this was our only contact with staff, as the hotel has no restaurant.. But hey, what's the point, this is London, where you are spoilt for choice when it comes to restaurants.The room was fine, but very basic which was fine for our purpose. Breakfast was available in the Italian restaurant on the ground floor. The location is ideal, it is on the corner of Oxford St and Regent St, within walking distance to a lot of shops and attractions. If you do not feel like walking, the buses and Underground are nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great for shoppers!”
Reviews.Author: MissMartti
Reviews.Content: Hotel was cute, we had a large upper floor room with a lovely view over the roof tops. Room was clean. There were no hotel services, but we didn't mind. I would recommend this hotel to younger couples who want to find a neat, clean and cute hotel in good location as I know in London you can't really find a good prices hotel that is also not a rat hole. If I couldn't get a room in five star hotels I would choose this one as the bests cheaper alternative!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, great location & service - no elevator thus be ready”
Reviews.Author: Varinia
Reviews.Content: Budget, good value for money, small and tasty breakfast, great service (e.g. arrived at 9:00am and was able to leave bags at reception; because had big bags they made effort to assign me a room on 1st floor - where reception was)

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bordelangster
Reviews.Content: Although the location of this hotel is good, the accomodation is dreadful. It lacked even the most basic amenities - there was no soap, bath mat or internet connection. There is also no lift (elevator) so I had to carry my bags up four steep flights of stairs. The hotel also charges 5% surcharge to use credit cards. There is much better hotels in London for the same price. I would not recommend that you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: dreamways
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my stay and would recommend this hotel to everyone looking for an afordable nice room in London. I stayed in room 14 (top floor) and had a nice french bed on my own. The room and bathroom were spacious and nicely furnished, the bed was very comfortable. The only minus was the noise of the nearby traffic (mostly during the day)since the windows arent double glassed. The location is fantastic for sighseeing and shopping-only a few meters from Oxford Street! I have stayed in another hotel (similar price range) in London before and Mermaid was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: gkslim
Reviews.Content: Graham & Kay, Durban, South Africa We found this budget hotel on the web and then checked out the comments on Tripadvisor. In spite of a few negative comments we were very happy with the hotel. The rooms are small but very clean, the reception was friendly and helpful, the location is great and the continental breakfast in the resturant downstairs is more than adequate. Where else can you find all this in London for less than GBP60 per night for 2. We will definetly recommend it to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Disgrace!Dirty!Unfriendly!Unsafe!etc etc etc.....”
Reviews.Author: MrsH77
Reviews.Content: I met my friend in London for a nice relaxing break from babies etc. We were expecting something nice and clean and something where we could put our feet up after a long day of shopping and theatre. Oh, how wrong we were!!! Firstly we were both 6 months pregnant. Once we found the "hotel" (located next to a restaurant and there is no proper hotel entrance, its just a door and you really won't know if you are walking into someones flat), the first thing that we saw was a huge flight of stairs!!! We struggled the bags up the stairs and then we saw a "reception" desk. We had to ask if this place was a hotel, because we were so unsure about it. After handing over a Â£10 deposit in order to receive our room key, we had to carry our bags yet another flight of stairs, and nobody offered to help. The room was SO dirty and horrible. The smell was something you would expect in a morgue, mixed with faint smell of gas. Stained beds, ripped sofa, mouldy bathroom, dirty curtains and only two lights were working in the room. We were given two large HANDTOWELS and nothing else. No shampoo etc, just some dove soap. Cheap toiletpaper and only one roll was left at a time!!! The beds were so uncomfortable, they must be several decades old, because we just kept sinking into them. Our backs were killing. We asked the man behind the receiption desk where our Cooked English Breakfast would be served, and he stated with very broken English that there only was continental breakfast available and that it would be served at 8am in the restaurant outside the "hotel". We had paid for Full English Breakfast when we booked the "hotel". When we told this to the man he said that we should complain to the airline company and that he would not do anything about it. Just one look at the restaurant made us decide that it was safer to go to some cafe for a breakfast than eat in that place. First night we could not even sleep, as someone was banging the doors so loudly. The doors are suppose to have door closers on them, but all of them are clearly broken, as the doors just keep slamming!!! When we checked out, again nobody would help us with the suitcases, even though we were clearly struggling. This place is an absolute disgrace and way overpriced. We paid Â£135 per night for a room!!! Even the location won't make up for this place. STAY CLEAR!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stairs a killer, but suite worth it!! Great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: gosia101
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by a tourism information kiosk at Waterloo station, and boy am I glad that I consulted them! The suites were spotless, the beds comfortable, the bathroom would not be out of place in a four-star hotel, the included breakfast simple and totally edible (I didn't take to English food, so this is high praise from me). The ladies who clean the suites do a really good job keeping everything in great shape. The Bond Street tube station was a two-minute walk away, and from there it was just minutes to anywhere you wanted to go, the West End was very close, if you're going to catch some plays. The area around the hotel seemed very safe to me, even late at night. My one quibble was the stairs. They are steep. There is no elevator. There is no bellhop. I used up a lot of calories carrying my very heavy suitcase up those stairs. If you're not into that much exercise, book ahead and ask for a suite on a lower floor.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: Shay4
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the mermaid suties and were pleasantly surpised to see that it was located directly in the middle of everything, from shopping, to a 5 minute walk to the tube, on a cosy little street between oxford and new bond street. For us it was a romantic 2 night stay. We loved it. The bed linens and everything else were very clean. The room was very bright and refreshing. Very spacious. Friendly staff, although there is usually only a receptionist around. the breakfast is accross the street. good. The bathroom is very modernized. We are trying to go back again. LOVED IT.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: vanducth
Reviews.Content: Just returned from London and wanted to post my review. The Mermain is located on Bond street just off Oxford Street . Its a stone throw away from London's Wests end Theatres and everything was on my doorstep. The hotel was abit pricy but its expected in Central London. One thing I would like to say is that there is no lift so if you are carrying alot of baggage I would ask for a room on the first floor as I did. Rooms are nice and spacious and clean. Bathroom was on the small side but it looks brand new. I have recommended it to my colleagues as our company is near by and I know my boss won't pay for us to stay in the Ritz. If you are looking for a good 3 star hotel right in the centre of London then I would head for the Mermaid.

HotelInfo.Name: Mermaid Suite Hotel
